intro: Polyarrhena, commonly known as the common marsh grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. These plants typically grow in wet or marshy environments, thriving in moist soils. Polyarrhena species are often found in temperate regions and are adapted to periodic flooding. They play an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
